page.title: 12Birds and Beasts
page.content: The most common birds in the area are gulls and starlings. These are successful because their food is plentiful.The peregrine falcon is the rarest breeding bird.There are now no wild choughs as in the war farmer ploughed up the land near the cliffs and destroyed their feeding grounds. The rabbits got myximatosis and died The buzzards had no food and became rare, but they are now on the increase again.Owls are also having a hard time because the farmers are knocking down the old barns and building new ones which are not suitable for them to nest in. The coast is important for breeding seabirds such as puffins guillimots razorbills and an increasing number of fulmars.There are many small mammals such as voles shrews and mice. There are also badger and foxes and breeding grey seals.
